data: In the last day of May in the early ’nineties, about six o’clock of the evening, old Jolyon Forsyte sat under the oak tree below the terrace of his house at Robin Hill.
last day of May | early ’nineties | six o’clock of the evening

The Forsyte Saga, Volume II.
Indian Summer of a Forsyte
In Chancery
